data.name: PrivacyStatementBoardMember
data.value:
The Department of Justice Canada is subject to the federal Privacy Act and is committed to the privacy and protection of your personal information. Your personal information is collected under the authority of the Public Service Employment Act, the Employment Equity Act, and the Canadian Human Rights Act (section 16).

How your personal information will be used:

Employment Equity self-declaration information you provide, through either the Department of Justice’s Self-Declaration Campaign or by informing HR in this staffing process, will only be made available on a need-to-know basis to authorized employees in order to conduct the staffing process. For more information please see the Employment Equity Personal Information bank – PSE 918.

Your Privacy Rights:

The collection, use and disclosure of personal information by the Department of Justice Canada isPage 3 of 4 in accordance with the Federal Privacy Act. This Act gives you the right to access your personal information held by the Department of Justice Canada and to request changes to incorrect personal information. To exercise these rights or if you require clarification about this Privacy Notice, please contact our Access to Information and Privacy Office at ATIP-AIP@justice.gc.ca and reference the Staffing Personal Information Bank - PSE 902.

Please note that you have a right to file a complaint to the Office of the Privacy Commissioner of Canada regarding our handling of your personal information. For more information, please visit the Privacy Commissioner’s website at www.Priv.gc.ca.

If you have any questions or concerns in regards to what is stated above, please contact {0}.

data.name: PrivacyStatementCandidate
data.value:
The Department of Justice Canada is subject to the federal Privacy Act and is committed to the privacy and protection of your personal information. Your personal information is collected under the authority of the Public Service Employment Act, the Employment Equity Act, and the Canadian Human Rights Act (section 16).

How your personal information will be used and is consistent with the consent provided when applying through GC Jobs:

The personal information you provide in this staffing process, will only be made available on a need-to-know basis to authorized employees in order to conduct the staffing process.

Employment Equity self-declaration information you provide, through either the Department of Justice’s Self-Declaration Campaign or by informing HR in this staffing process, will only be made available on a need-to-know basis to authorized employees in order to conduct the staffing process. For more information please see the Employment Equity Personal Information bank – PSE 918.

Your Privacy Rights:

The collection, use and disclosure of personal information by the Department of Justice Canada is in accordance with the Federal Privacy Act. This Act gives you the right to access your personal information held by the Department of Justice Canada and to request changes to incorrect personal information. To exercise these rights or if you require clarification about this Privacy Notice, please contact our Access to Information and Privacy Office at ATIP-AIP@justice.gc.ca and reference the Staffing Personal Information Bank - PSE 902.

Please note that you have a right to file a complaint to the Office of the Privacy Commissioner of Canada regarding our handling of your personal information. For more information, please visit the Privacy Commissioner’s website at www.Priv.gc.ca.

If you have any questions or concerns in regards to what is stated above, please contact {0}.
